title: Integrate with Jira for SAM
content:
This page describes how to configure an integration with Atlassian Jira Software Cloud to import license consumption and user entitlement data. This is part of the SaaS product setup in SAM.

Generate an account token in Jira

The Jira integration uses Basic Authentication for different APIs. To configure basic authentication, follow these steps:

  1. Log in to the Atlassian Developer console.
  2. Click your profile in the upper right corner and select Account settings.
  3. In the Contact section, select Anyone to grant access to your email address.
    If you are concerned about security issues related to sharing personal email addresses, you don’t need to make any changes here. When importing user entitlements, the accountId will be used as the user principal name instead of the email.
  4. Go to the Security tab page and create an API token by following the instructions in Manage API tokens for your Atlassian account. Note down this token for later use. See the Create an endpoint section below.

Obtain Cloud ID value 

Obtain the value of Cloud ID of the Jira cloud instance. This value is required during the endpoint configuration in Integration Studio. 

  1. Log in to Atlassian Administration.
  2. Select the required organization. If there's only one organization, you will go to the organization directly. 
  3. Locate Jira in the product list, click the three dots button in the Actions column, and select Manage Product. 
  4. Check the browser URL and note down the Cloud ID for later use. The Cloud ID is the last section of the browser URL, which is in this format:  
    https://admin.atlassian.com/o/<organization_id>/products/jira-software/<cloud_id>

Prepare an integration user

Before setting up the integration, prepare an integration user.

Set up the Jira integration in Service Management

To set up the Jira integration for data import, complete the following tasks.

Create an endpoint

Create an endpoint using the Rest Executor 2.0 endpoint type:

  1. Log in to the Agent Interface as the integration administrator.
  2. Navigate to Administration > Utilities > Integration > Endpoints.
  3. Click Add.
  4. Select Rest Executor 2.0 as the endpoint type, enter a name for the endpoint (for example, Jira), and then click Add. The system creates the endpoint.
  5. Click Configure and specify the following fields:

    Field

    Value
    Agent Select Agentless for a direct connection to Jira.
    Authentication type Select Basic Authentication.
    Protocol Select https.
    Base URL Enter the base URL of the Jira system: https://<FQDN>
    Username Enter the username of the integration user of the Jira system.
    Password

    Enter the API token of the integration user of the Jira system.

    This is not the user's password but instead the API token for the Jira user.
    Confirm password Re-enter the API token.
    Certificate type Select X.509
    Certificate format Select PEM

    Server certificate

    Open the root CA certificate file of the Jira system in a text editor, and then copy and paste the content to this field. If the content is invalid, an error occurs when you click Save in the next step. 

    The certificate content must resemble the following.


    -----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----
    MIIF2TCCBMGgAwIBAgIQBMF1U8hY8bivE0+JHx922jANBgkqhkiG9w0BAQsFADBG
    MQswCQYDVQQGEwJVUzEPMA0GA1UEChMGQW1hem9uMRUwEwYDVQQLEwxTZXJ2ZXIg
    Q0EgMUIxDzANBgNVBAMTBkFtYXpvbjAeFw0yMTEwMTEwMDAwMDBaFw0yMjExMDky
    MzU5NTlaMBsxGTAXBgNVBAMTEHhpZS5pdHNtYS1uZy5vcmcwggEiMA0GCSqGSIb3
    1oIvQfpl2gj0S6JSJAYjJnY7HKCa7mkzBMiiXWI5aHMZfl1FsaNARM10LUpto61f
    Ivk/SDNlOqVXuzGMTZkJBVZVmK5lNLvBB1Gk9+QlJ+SuUOW7FW2K5U+oQKWsHtvH
    C/DHn6yyhvqWes9q6A==
    -----END CERTIFICATE-----
  6. Click Get token and then complete the login and consent process. If your endpoint configuration is correct, you will see the Available status in the Token status section after the process is finished.
  7. Click Save.

Create an integration

In the following steps, you'll create an integration with the predefined template.

  1. Navigate to Administration > Utilities > Integration > Integration Studio.
  2. Click New, enter the name of your integration, and then click Save. The system displays the Integration page.
  3. In the Details section, configure the integration user you created for the current Service Management system and click Active to activate the integration.
  4. In the Connector-Endpoint mappings section, click Add to add a mapping.
  5. Select Jira as the connector, select the Jira endpoint you created earlier, and then enter an alias for the mapping.
  6. Click Save.

Add the scenario

Perform the following steps to add a scenario to the integration:

  1. Click Add scenario.
  2. Enter a name for the scenario.
  3. In the Template field, select SAM - Import Jira license consumption.
    • Using the out-of-the-box template simplifies integration configuration compared to starting from scratch. If you choose not to use this option, you'll need to manually build your logic from a blank slate.
    • You can update the APIVersion key in the template based on your business requirements.
  4. Click Save to add the scenario. 
  5. Follow the above steps again to add the "Import Jira license consumption" scenario. This time, select the SAM - Import Jira user entitlement template.

Next steps

Complete the remaining steps of the SaaS product configuration process:

  • Create and configure the Jira product in SAM
  • Create license metrics (if necessary)
  • Create licenses for services included in Jira (if necessary)
  • Verify the Jira integration
  • Verify the details of the license models for Jira services
  • Schedule the periodic triggering of the integration
